title: Vintage 70s Deka Plastics Inc Logo
content:
Looking for this fonts used to create this logo.

It looks like a combination of two different fonts but I'm not sure it may just be the weight of the characters themselves that make it look like it's two different fonts.

Also some of the terminals seem to have a slight serif almost like a Cooper black terminal only not so extreme.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017054023im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DekaLogo_3671.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [DekaLogo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017054023/http:/typophile.com/files/DekaLogo.jpg) | 67.72 KB |
author: PDA

comments.content: The overall clumsiness of every single letter leads me to believe that it was done by hand...
I'm not sure, the bowls of the D and A are almost the same and the curved terminals of the A and the E are close in curvature. The only thing that looks clumsy to me is the K with it's weird leg.
